FuncDef:
The vrrp6 vrid join load-balance-vrrp command adds a specified VRRP6 backup group to a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol for IPv6 (VRRP6) load-balance redundancy group (LBRG).
The undo vrrp6 vrid join load-balance-vrrp command deletes a specified VRRP6 backup group from a VRRP6 LBRG. The vrrp6 vrid join load-balance-vrrp command adds a specified VRRP6 backup group to a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol for IPv6 (VRRP6) load-balance redundancy group (LBRG). The undo vrrp6 vrid join load-balance-vrrp command deletes a specified VRRP6 backup group from a VRRP6 LBRG. By default, no VRRP6 backup group is added to a VRRP6 LBRG. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VRRP6 backup group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the ID of a VRRP6 LBRG.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

ExtraInfo: To implement VRRP6 single-gateway load balancing, run the vrrp6 vrid join load-balance-vrrp command to add a specified VRRP6 backup group to a VRRP6 LBRG. The VRRP6 LBRG uses the virtual MAC addresses of the VRRP6 backup groups in it to respond to different users' NS request packets destined for virtual IPv6 addresses. The master device of a specified VRRP6 backup group forwards the traffic of a specified user, implementing load balancing.
